title: Southampton ready to sack manager Ralph Hasenhuttl following 9-0 defeat at home to Leicester
text:
Southampton are ready to wield the axe on Ralph Hassenhutl after the St Mary’s humiliation against Leicester brought his position to a head.

Hassenhutl has been under increasing pressure following a wretched start to the season and Sportsmail understands intermediaries connected to the club have been formulating a list of potential names to replace the Austrian.

Southampton were ripped to pieces by Brendan Rodgers’s Leicester team. They were reduced to 10 men in the first half when Ryan Bertrand was sent off but it was the manner in which they collapsed - thanks to lamentable defending - that has put Hassenhutl on the brink.

Southampton are prepared to sack Ralph Hasenhuttl following the 9-0 loss to Leicester

They now have a goal difference of minus 15 and their inability to keep clean sheets has Southampton’s hierarchy fearing for their Premier League prospects.

They have only won two of their 10 fixtures so far and some of Hassenhutl’s methods have been questioned within the dressing room.

Intermediaries connected to the club have been formulating a list of possible replacements

The worrying aspect for Southampton is they now have back-to-back games against Manchester City in the Carabao Cup and Premier League and it remains to be seen whether Hassenhutl will be given a stay of the execution or the board take action.

Hassenhutl was only appointed by Southampton last December and he achieved his goal of keeping them in the Premier League. Progress this year, however, has stalled dramatically to leave the 52-year-old on the brink.
